Mouth and Teeth:  Clean mouth and teeth are important for health and for social 
reasons. Unclean mouth and teeth can give you bad breath. The teeth must be 
kept clean and gums massaged. This is important as the gums support the teeth. 
Hygiene of the mouth has to be maintained right from birth. 
Infants and children
✱  The mouth, tongue and gums must be gently wiped at least 2-3 times a 
day, using a finger wrapped with a soft, clean, damp cloth. This will prevent 
formation of white deposit seen on the tongue and mouth of infants taking 
milk.  
✱  When the teeth begin to appear, the gums should be gently massaged using clean finger with glycerin or a little vegetable oil.  
✱  Once the child is old enough, he/she should be taught to brush the teeth using a soft toothbrush with toothpaste or tooth powder after every meal 
and at night. The child can be taught to massage the gums with the fingers.
